comments:
Build ID: I20070222-0951

Steps To Reproduce:
I tried to create a Java5EE Enterprise Application project against a generic runtime.

I choose "new enterprise application project", entered a name, picked the runtime and choose the "5.0" ear facet.
I added the modules "Application client", "EJB project" and "Web project".

A dialog with this message came up:

java.lang.Error: Unresolved compilation problems:

	JEEConstants cannot be resolved

	The method addToClasspath(IJavaProject, IClasspathEntry) is undefined for the type WebFacetInstallDelegate
	JEEConstants cannot be resolved

Back to the "J2EE modules to add to the ear" window, I see that only the EJB- and the web project were added. But the window shows an error message "The Module specification level of ProjectNameEJB, is incompatible with the containing EAR version".

(Minor error: above the textbox with the text "EAR Content", there is a message "NLS missing message: contentDirLabel in: org.eclipse.jst.jee.ui.project.facet.EarFacetInstallPage")


Then I tried to create an EAR project without any modules and EAR 5.0 facet. This worked.
I added an EJB project (worked without problems).
I tried to add a Web project with facets "Java 5.0" and "Dynamic Web Module 2.5". The project was created on clicking finish, but the wizard did not close !
In the .log file the same error message as above was. I could not add the "Dynamic Web Module 2.5" facet in the project properties, this resulted in the same error message.
The application client project ("Application client module 5.0") worked fine.


More information:
My installation came from these packages:
eclipse-SDK-3.3M5eh-win32.zip
emf-sdo-runtime-2.3.0M5.zip
xsd-runtime-2.3.0M5.zip
GEF-runtime-3.3M5.zip
dtp_1.5M5.zip
wtp-S-2.0M5-200702230758.zip
Raj,  this looks like the same build problem we just fixed.  Can you verify that and then resolve this bug?

Hi Chuck,

    I verified that this works in the new build and indeed is that bug.
I cannot resolve it (access rights)

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 174769 ***
